title: let `yarn build` warn if local yarn version not support workspaces
body:
**Do you want to request a *feature* or report a *bug*?**

Feature

**What is the current behavior?**

I got the error below when my local yarn version was v0.21.

```js
Error: Cannot find module 'react'
    at Function.Module._resolveFilename (module.js:485:15)
    at Function.resolve (internal/module.js:18:19)
    at createBundle (~/Documents/repo/dev/react/scripts/rollup/build.js:536:31)
    at tasks.push (~/Documents/repo/dev/react/scripts/rollup/build.js:632:13)
    at runWaterfall (~/Documents/repo/dev/react/scripts/rollup/build.js:687:23)
    at nextPromise.then (~/Documents/repo/dev/react/scripts/rollup/build.js:693:12)
    at <anonymous> code: 'MODULE_NOT_FOUND'
```

I think maybe should upgrade my yarn because the `react` module land at package folder.

And I upgrade yarn, and try to exec the `yarn` command, then `yarn build`, and it work.

~~**If the current behavior is a bug, please provide the steps to reproduce and if possible a minimal demo of the problem via https://jsfiddle.net or similar (template for React 16: https://jsfiddle.net/Luktwrdm/, template for React 15: https://jsfiddle.net/hmbg7e9w/).**~~

No

**What is the expected behavior?**

I think it would be great if we throw a warning not a ambiguous error.

**Which versions of React, and which browser / OS are affected by this issue? Did this work in previous versions of React?**

* React v16.1
* OSX
